shortdef: distorted or unshapely in form : misshapen

dt: {bc}to alter the shape of by stress
{bc}to become misshapen or changed in shape

pt: {sc}deform{/sc} {sc}distort{/sc} {sc}contort{/sc} {sc}warp{/sc} means to mar or spoil by or as if by twisting. {sc}deform{/sc} may imply a change of shape through stress, injury, or accident of growth.
{sc}distort{/sc} and {sc}contort{/sc} both imply a wrenching from the natural or normal, but {sc}contort{/sc} suggests a more involved twisting and a more grotesque and painful result.

pt.t: the odd camera angle {it}distorts{/it} the figure

pt: {sc}warp{/sc} indicates an uneven shrinking that bends or twists out of a flat plane.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French or Latin; Anglo-French {it}desfurmer{/it}, from Latin {it}deformare{/it}, from {it}de-{/it} + {it}formare{/it} to form, from {it}forma{/it} form
shortdef: to spoil the looks of : disfigure
